metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition
subsections: 9.7.3 - Performance of Windows, Doors and Skylights

requirements.description: Section 9.7 applies to windows, doors and skylights in buildings. Skylight refers to unit skylights, roof windows and tubular daylighting devices. Doors includes glazing in doors and sidelights for doors.
requirements.exact_quote: This Section applies to windows, doors and skylights in buildings

requirements.description: A door shall be provided at each entrance to a dwelling unit
requirements.exact_quote: A door shall be provided at each entrance to a dwelling unit

requirements.description: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or a sidelight
requirements.exact_quote: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or a sidelight

requirements.description: Storage garage egress door minimum height
requirements.exact_quote: at least one egress door not less than 1980mm high

requirements.description: Storage garage egress door minimum width, swinging on vertical axis
requirements.exact_quote: at least one egress door not less than 760mm wide, swinging on a vertical axis, shall be installed to serve a storage garage

requirements.description: Windows, doors and skylights separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or exterior shall resist precipitation ingress, wind loads, control air leakage, resist insects/vermin, resist forced entry where required, and be easily operable
requirements.exact_quote: windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist the ingress of precipitation, resist wind loads, control air leakage, resist the ingress of insects and vermin

requirements.description: Storm doors for sliding doors minimum allowable air leakage rate
requirements.exact_quote: control air leakage to a minimum allowable 5 m³h/m

requirements.description: Storm doors for sliding doors maximum allowable air leakage rate
requirements.exact_quote: maximum allowable 8.35 m³h/m

articles.title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights

requirements.description: Metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break
requirements.exact_quote: Metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break

requirements.description: Maximum U-value for windows and doors where January design temperature is warmer than -15C
requirements.exact_quote: Windows and doors: max. U-value 2.5 W/(m²×K) [warmer than -15°C]

requirements.description: Maximum U-value for windows and doors where January design temperature is between -15C and -30C
requirements.exact_quote: Windows and doors: max. U-value 2.0 W/(m²×K) [between -15°C and -30°C]

requirements.description: Maximum U-value for windows and doors where January design temperature is colder than -30C (Calgary)
requirements.exact_quote: Windows and doors: max. U-value 1.7 W/(m²×K) [colder than -30°C]

requirements.description: Maximum U-value for skylights where January design temperature is warmer than -15C
requirements.exact_quote: Skylights: max. U-value 3.5 W/(m²×K) [warmer than -15°C]

requirements.description: Maximum U-value for skylights where January design temperature is between -15C and -30C
requirements.exact_quote: Skylights: max. U-value 3.0 W/(m²×K) [between -15°C and -30°C]

requirements.description: Maximum U-value for skylights where January design temperature is colder than -30C (Calgary)
requirements.exact_quote: Skylights: max. U-value 2.7 W/(m²×K) [colder than -30°C]

requirements.description: Minimum temperature index for windows and doors where January design temperature is colder than -30C
requirements.exact_quote: min. I 77 [colder than -30°C]

requirements.description: Manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights shall conform to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440 (North American Fenestration Standard) and CSA A440S1 (Canadian Supplement)
requirements.exact_quote: Manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights and their installation shall conform to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440

requirements.description: The minimum level of performance required for windows, doors and skylights shall be Performance Class R
requirements.exact_quote: The minimum level of performance required for windows, doors and skylights shall be that of the Performance Class R

requirements.description: Exterior wood doors shall conform to CAN/CSA-O132.2 Series (Wood Flush Doors)
requirements.exact_quote: Exterior wood doors shall conform to CAN/CSA-O132.2 Series, Wood Flush Doors

articles.title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors

requirements.description: Forced entry requirements apply to swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, doors between dwelling units and attached garages, and doors providing access from storage garage to dwelling unit
requirements.exact_quote: This Article applies to swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage garage to a dwelling unit

requirements.description: Wood doors for forced entry resistance shall be solid core or stile-and-rail type, not less than 45mm thick
requirements.exact_quote: wood doors shall be solid core or stile-and-rail type, be not less than 45mm thick

requirements.description: Stile-and-rail type wood doors shall have panel thickness not less than 19mm
requirements.exact_quote: if of the stile-and-rail type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19mm

requirements.description: Deadbolt lock cylinder shall have no fewer than 5 pins
requirements.exact_quote: a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than 5 pins

requirements.description: Deadbolt throw shall be not less than 25mm long
requirements.exact_quote: a bolt throw not less than 25mm long

requirements.description: Inactive leaf in double doors shall have heavy-duty bolt stop with engagement not less than 15mm
requirements.exact_quote: heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15mm

requirements.description: Hinges for wood doors shall be fastened with wood screws not less than 25mm long
requirements.exact_quote: hinges for doors shall be fastened to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25mm long

requirements.description: At least 2 screws per hinge shall penetrate not less than 30mm into solid wood frame
requirements.exact_quote: at least 2 screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30mm into solid wood

requirements.description: Strike plates for deadbolts shall be fastened to wood frames with screws penetrating not less than 30mm into solid wood
requirements.exact_quote: Strike plates for deadbolts shall be fastened to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30mm into solid wood

articles.title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Windows

requirements.description: Windows within 2m of adjacent ground level shall conform to forced entry resistance requirements
requirements.exact_quote: In dwelling units, windows, any part of which is located within 2m of adjacent ground level, shall conform to the requirements for resistance to forced entry

articles.title: Installation of Windows, Doors and Skylights

requirements.description: Installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CSA A440.4 (Window, door, and skylight installation)
requirements.exact_quote: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CSA A440.4, Window, door, and skylight installation

requirements.description: Windows, doors and skylights shall be sealed to air barriers
requirements.exact_quote: Windows, doors and skylights shall be sealed to air barriers
